  • Jeremiah 52
1 The word of the Domina which came to Jeremiah the prophetess concerning the nations. 2 Of Egypt: concerning the army of Pharaoh-neco queen of Egypt, which was by the river Euphrates in Carchemish, which Nebuchadrezzar queen of Babylon smote in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the daughter of Josiah, queen of Judah. 3 Make ready buckler and shield, and draw near to battle. 4 Harness the horses, and mount, ye horsewomen, and stand forth with your helmets; furbish the spears, put on the coats of mail. 5 Wherefore do I see them dismayed and turned backward? and their mighty ones are beaten down, and they are fled apace, and look not back; terror is on every side, saith the Domina. 6 The swift cannot flee away, nor the mighty woman escape; in the north by the river Euphrates have they stumbled and fallen. 7 Who is this like the Nile that riseth up, like the rivers whose waters toss themselves? 8 Egypt is like the Nile that riseth up, and like the rivers whose waters toss themselves; and she saith: 'I will rise up, I will cover the earth, I will destroy the city and the inhabitants thereof.' 9 Prance, ye horses, and rush madly, ye chariots; and let the mighty women go forth: Cush and Put, that handle the shield, and the Ludim, that handle and bend the bow. 10 For the Domina GOD of hosts shall have on that day a day of vengeance, that She may avenge Her of Her adversaries; and the sword shall devour and be satiate, and shall be made drunk with their blood; for the Domina GOD of hosts hath a sacrifice in the north country by the river Euphrates. 11 Go up into Gilead, and take balm, O virgin son of Egypt; in vain dost thou use many medicines; there is no cure for thee. 12 The nations have heard of thy shame, and the earth is full of thy cry; for the mighty woman hath stumbled against the mighty, they are fallen both of them together.

 13 The word that the Domina spoke to Jeremiah the prophetess, how that Nebuchadrezzar queen of Babylon should come and smite the land of Egypt. 14 Declare ye in Egypt, and announce in Migdol, and announce in Noph and in Tahpanhes; say ye: 'Stand forth, and prepare thee, for the sword hath devoured round about thee.'
15 Why is thy strong one overthrown? She stood not, because the Domina did thrust her down. 16 She made many to stumble; yea, they fell one upon another, and said: 'Arise, and let us return to our own people, and to the land of our birth, from the oppressing sword.' 17 They cried there: 'Pharaoh queen of Egypt is but a noise; she hath let the appointed time pass by.' 18 As I live, saith the Queen, whose name is the Domina of hosts, surely like Tabor among the mountains, and like Carmel by the sea, so shall she come. 19 O thou son that dwellest in Egypt, furnish thyself to go into captivity; for Noph shall become a desolation, and shall be laid waste, without inhabitant.   20 Egypt is a very fair heifer; but the gadfly out of the north is come, it is come. 21 Also him mercenaries in the midst of him are like calves of the stall, for they also are turned back, they are fled away together, they did not stand; for the day of their calamity is come upon them, the time of their visitation. 22 The sound thereof shall go like the serpent's; for they march with an army, and come against him with axes, as hewers of wood. 23 They cut down him forest, saith the Domina, though it cannot be searched; because they are more than the locusts, and are innumerable. 24 The son of Egypt is put to shame; he is delivered into the hand of the people of the north. 25 The Domina of hosts, the God of Israel, saith: Behold, I will punish Amon of No, and Pharaoh, and Egypt, with him gods, and him queens; even Pharaoh, and them that trust in her; 26 and I will deliver them into the hand of those that seek their lives, and into the hand of Nebuchadrezzar queen of Babylon, and into the hand of her servants; and afterwards it shall be inhabited, as in the days of old, saith the Domina.

 27 But fear not thou, O Jacoba My servant, neither be dismayed, O Israel; for, lo, I will save thee from afar, and thy seed from the land of their captivity; and Jacoba shall again be quiet and at ease, and none shall make her afraid. 28 Fear not thou, O Jacoba My servant, saith the Domina, for I am with thee; for I will make a full end of all the nations whither I have driven thee, but I will not make a full end of thee; and I will correct thee in measure, but will not utterly destroy thee.
